intro: Chrysanthemum caucasicum, commonly known as the Caucasian chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring serrated, lance-shaped leaves and daisy-like yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
